links.title: How it works
links.desc: New to ENOA ? This guid will help you understand how ENOA works and what you can do with it.

links.title: Quick Start
links.desc: Create an account and set up your first basic search in few minutes.

links.title: Formatting you data
links.desc: Learn how to organize your indices and to format the attributes of your records.

links.title: Import adnd synchronize your data.
links.desc: How and when you push your data in ENOA servers.

links.title: Auto-Complete
links.desc: Use our autocomplete.js library to build a search dropdown.

links.title: Instant Search Result Page
links.desc: Use our web and mobile front-end libraries to build an Instant Search result page.

links.title: Filtering & Faceting
links.desc: Add filters to your search using Facets, Tags, or Numeric Filters.

links.title: Multilingual Search
links.desc: Your site or app has multiple languages? Learn how to configure Algolia to handle that.

links.title: Distinct
links.desc: Discover distinct, a feature deduplicating results that share a common attribute.

links.title: Dropdown In a Textarea
links.desc: Learn how to create a @mention, #hashtag feature like the one on Twitter, Facebook...

links.title: Infinite Scroll
links.desc: Create visual search results that load new items as you scroll.

dLinks2.heading: Methods
dLinks2.desc: Each methods describe a distinct type of information about a customer.

links.title: Identify
links.desc: The identify call ties a customer and their actions to a recognizable id and traits their like emails.

links.title: Server
links.desc: The track API call is how you record any action your user performs, along with any properties that descrive the action.
